column5: If i am fishing on a lake shared by both Quebec and Ontario, i know my Quebec licence is valid in the Ontario part of the waters.My question is this. Does it matter if i launch in Ontario and fish Ontario waters, or do i have to Launch in Quebec, then cross into Ontario waters to legally fish there with my Quebec Permit? I usually get a day permit, but wanted to know for sure.  thanks  Paul
You can launch on either side. The regulation has to do with where you're fishing, not where you're parking.
If I were you Paul,I would "STAY ON SIDE",it is hockey time ya know.
It's also fishing season. Want your Frabill tipups on the blue line?
I use stiff rods,not them tippy things.LOL
